Accordions

Accordions are used to allow users to show or hide sections of content.

Guidelines

Accordions are used to hide sections of content on a page, where an abundance of content might otherwise overwhelm a user.

  • Only use an accordion when there is enough content to condense.
  • Use accordions when users need to consume specific areas of content within a page, or when vertical space is limited.
  • Don’t collapse important content by default, as users may easily miss it.

Documentation

Bootstrap Documentation

UXFrame has built-in smart defaults to distinguish between if a gray accordion or white accordion will be shown based on whether or not the accordion is used within a card.

Modifiers

Class Description
.uxf-card-accordion-white add class to div.uxf-accordion element to override smart defaults and apply white accordion styles
.uxf-card-accordion-gray add class to div.uxf-accordion element to override smart defaults and apply gray accordion styles

Javascript

Accordions use Bootstrap's collapse plugin.

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2

  1. Change div.accordion to div.panel.panel-accordion
  2. Change div.panel-title to h4.panel-title
  3. Change div.body to div.panel-body
  4. Surround div.panel-body with div.panel-collapse.collapse
  5. Surround h4.panel-title with div.panel-heading.accordion-toggle
  6. Add id="{your.chosen.id}" to div.panel.panel-accordion
  7. Add data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="{div.accordion id}" data-target="{div.panel-collapse.collapse id}" to div.panel-heading.accordion-toggle
  8. Add id="{another.chosen.id}" to div.panel-collapse.collapse
  9. Add the aria-expanded state to both div.panel-heading.accordion-toggle and div.panel-collapse.collapse
